question: Why is the Bhagavad-Gita the perfect theistic science? (1.1)
answer: "It is the perfect theistic science because it is directly spoken by the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Lord Śrī Kṛṣṇa."
open_ai_generated_answer:
Sanskrit Transliteration:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
इमं विवस्वते योगं प्रोक्तवानहमव्ययम् |
विवस्वान् मनवे प्राह मनुरिक्ष्वाकवेऽब्रवीत् || (BG 4.1)

Translation:
The Supreme Personality of Godhead said: I instructed this imperishable science of yoga to the sun-god, Vivasvan, and Vivasvan instructed it to Manu, the father of mankind, and Manu in turn instructed it to Ikshvaku.

Explanation:
The Bhagavad Gita is the perfect theistic science because it is directly spoken by Lord Krishna, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, to Arjuna. In this verse, Krishna explains the disciplic succession of knowledge, showing that this transcendental knowledge has been passed down through saintly kings and sages. This knowledge is eternal and unchanging, meant to guide all living beings back to their original spiritual nature.

Srila Prabhupada emphasizes the importance of receiving knowledge through the proper disciplic succession, as it ensures the purity and authenticity of the teachings. By following the instructions of a bona fide spiritual master who is connected to this disciplic succession, one can understand the Bhagavad Gita in its true essence.

Practical Application:
To deepen your understanding of the Bhagavad Gita, it is essential to study it under the guidance of a qualified spiritual master who is part of the disciplic succession. Regularly reading and contemplating the verses of the Gita, along with applying its teachings in your daily life, will help you progress on the path of Krishna consciousness.

Encouragement:
By studying the Bhagavad Gita with sincerity and devotion, you will gradually uncover the profound wisdom and spiritual truths it contains. Stay committed to your spiritual practices, seek guidance from advanced devotees, and always remember Lord Krishna's words to Arjuna as a source of inspiration and guidance on your spiritual journey. Keep faith in the process and continue your pursuit of self-realization with determination and enthusiasm. Jai Shri Krishna!

question: Why was Dhritarashtra fearful about the outcome of the battle? (1.1)
answer: "Because the battle was arranged to be fought at Kurukṣetra, which is mentioned elsewhere in the Vedas as a place of worship - even for the denizens of heaven - Dhṛtarāṣṭra became very fearful about the influence of the holy place on the outcome of the battle. He knew very well that this would influence Arjuna and the sons of Pāṇḍu favorably, because by nature they were all virtuous."
open_ai_generated_answer:
Sanskrit Transliteration:
धृतराष्ट्र उवाच |
धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः |
मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय || (BG 1.1)

English Translation:
Dhritarashtra said: O Sanjaya, after assembling in the place of pilgrimage at Kurukshetra, what did my sons and the sons of Pandu do, being desirous to fight?

Explanation:
Dhritarashtra was fearful about the outcome of the battle because he was attached to his sons, the Kauravas, who were on the side of adharma (unrighteousness). He knew that the Pandavas, who were on the side of dharma (righteousness), had Lord Krishna as their charioteer, and thus he feared the consequences of fighting against them.

Srila Prabhupada explains that Dhritarashtra's attachment to his sons blinded him to the principles of dharma and adharma. This attachment led to his fear and anxiety about the outcome of the battle. Similarly, when we are attached to material things or relationships, we may also experience fear and anxiety because we are not aligned with the principles of dharma.

Practical Application:
To overcome fear and anxiety, we must cultivate detachment and focus on performing our duties according to the principles of dharma. By surrendering to Lord Krishna and following His instructions in the Bhagavad Gita, we can transcend material attachments and find inner peace and strength.

Further Study:
You may explore Chapter 2 of the Bhagavad Gita, where Lord Krishna imparts the teachings of karma-yoga and detachment, which can help us overcome fear and anxiety.

Encouragement:
By understanding and applying the teachings of the Bhagavad Gita in our lives, we can overcome fear and anxiety and progress on the path of spiritual realization. Have faith in Lord Krishna's guidance and continue your spiritual journey with determination. Hare Krishna!

question: What is Duryodhana's purpose in speaking to Dronacarya?
answer: Duryodhana pointed out that Drona trained Dristadyumna, even though he was destined to kill Drona.... Drona did this because Dristadyumna was in the right caste and he thought he deserved to learn..."Duryodhana pointed out this mistake of Droṇācārya's so that he might be alert and uncompromising in the fighting. By this he wanted to point out also that he should not be similarly lenient in battle against the Pāṇḍavas- such leniency would lead to defeat."

By studying and applying the teachings of the Bhagavad Gita, we can navigate our way towards spiritual growth and enlightenment. Keep faith in Krishna's plan and continue your journey with determination and devotion. Hare Krishna!

question: Describe the significance of the blowing of conchshells on both the sides. (1.14, 1.19)
answer:
-"The sounding of the transcendental conchshells of Krsna and Arjuna indicated that there was no hope of victory for the other side because Kṛṣṇa was on the side of the Pāṇḍavas.'"

This is due to the Pāṇḍavas and their confidence in Lord Kṛṣṇa. One who takes shelter of the Supreme Lord has nothing to fear, even in the midst of the greatest calamity."

-Vikarma means activities prohibited in the Vedas which yield bad

-Akarma refers to work performed in Kṛṣṇa's service producing no material reactions, neither good nor bad.

question: Explain the analogy of the sparrow. (6.24)
answer:
We should learn determination from the sparrow who lost her eggs in the ocean. She decided to dry up the ocean to get her eggs, and everyone thought she was foolish to have such determination. But Garuda saw her efforts and was compassionate to the sparrow and helped her get her eggs back.

In the same way, although we cannot go back to Godhead solely by our own endeavors, if we put forth maximum effort with determination, Krsna will be merciful unto us and provide us with tremendous help.
